key_title: Key to the species of Myosotis

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Boraginaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Boraginaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Boraginaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stamens fully exserted from corolla-tube; flowers fragrant
Stamens included in corolla-tube (anthers sometimes exserted in M. australis); flowers not fragrant
Calyx-hairs appressed, not hooked; leaf-hairs appressed
Corolla pale blue to sky blue with a yellow throat; pedicel longer than calyx in fruit
Corolla white or yellow, sometimes turning pale blue; pedicel shorter than calyx in fruit
Style about as long as stamens; corolla 6–10 mm diam., lobes more than 2 mm long
Style shorter than stamens; corolla 2–5 mm diam., lobes less than 2 mm long
Corolla white or yellow; inflorescence axis hairs spreading; calyx-lobes triangular and c. twice as long as wide in fruit; calyx-hairs usually long and dense
Corolla white or yellow, turning blue; inflorescence axis hairs appressed; calyx-lobes linear to narrow-triangular and 2.5–3 times longer than wide in fruit; calyx-hairs short and sparse
